ojc.ahni.transcriber

Class ESHyperNEATTranscriberBain

  • java.lang.Object
    • ojc.ahni.transcriber.HyperNEATTranscriber<BainNN>
      • ojc.ahni.transcriber.ESHyperNEATTranscriberBain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transcriber<BainNN>, Configurable, AHNIEventListener

    public class ESHyperNEATTranscriberBain
extends HyperNEATTranscriber<BainNN>
implements AHNIEventListener
    Constructs a Bain neural network from a chromosome using the ES-HyperNEAT encoding scheme (see Risi S. and Stanley K.O. (2012) An Enhanced Hypercube-Based Encoding for Evolving the Placement, Density and Connectivity of Neurons. Artificial Life, MIT Press). An ActivatorTranscriber should be used to construct an instance of this class. ActivatorTranscriber.newActivator(Chromosome) is then used to get the resulting network. To transcribe the neural network from a chromosome a connective pattern producing network (CPPN) is created from the chromosome, and then this is "queried" to determine the weights of the neural network according to the ES-HyperNEAT algorithm. The CPPN is an AnjiNet. The ES-HyperNEAT algorithm code is adapted from code by Sebastian Risi as part of the "ES-HyperNEAT C#" package.
    Author:
    Oliver Coleman

      • ES_HYPERNEAT_3D_PSEUDO

        public static final java.lang.String ES_HYPERNEAT_3D_PSEUDO
        If true then the substrate is considered as occupying a 3D space, with the input and outputs located on the XY plane at z=-1 and z=1 respectively, and hidden neurons located on the ZX plane at y=0. If false then all neurons are located in a 2D plane with X-Y axes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • quadTreeInitialisation

        public ESHyperNEATTranscriberBain.QuadPoint quadTreeInitialisation(HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN cppn,
                                                          Point n,
                                                          boolean outgoing,
                                                          double[] tempStorageForCPPNValues)
        Creates a quadtree by recursively subdividing the initial square, which spans the space from (-1, -1) to (1, 1), until a desired initial resolution is reached. For every quadtree square with centre (x, y) the CPPN is queried with arguments (a, b, x, y) and the resulting connection weight value w is stored.
        Parameters:
        cppn - The CPPN to use.
        n - The source or target neuron position.
        outgoing - Specifies whether the connection is for a source (outgoing = true) or target node (outgoing = false).
        tempStorageForCPPNValues - A list store the CPPN value for each node in the quadtree. Allows reuse of same list for performance reasons.
        Returns:
        The root of the generated quadtree, each QuadPoint stores CPPN activation level for its position.

      • pruneAndExpress

        protected void pruneAndExpress(HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN cppn,
                   Point neuron,
                   java.util.List<ESHyperNEATTranscriberBain.TempConnection> connections,
                   ESHyperNEATTranscriberBain.QuadPoint root,
                   boolean outgoing,
                   double[] tempStorageForCPPNValues)
        The given quadtree is traversed depth-first until the current node's variance is smaller than the variance threshold or until the node has no children (which means that the variance is zero). Subsequently, a connection (a, b, x, y) is created for each qualifying node with centre (x, y). Thus adds connections that are in bands of the two-dimensional cross-section of the hypercube containing the source or target node to the connections list.
        Parameters:
        cppn - The CPPN to use.
        neuron - The source or target neuron (position).
        connections - The list to add new connections to.
        root - The root of the quadtree.
        outgoing - Specifies whether the connection is for a source (outgoing = true) or target node (outgoing = false).
        tempStorageForCPPNValues - A list store the CPPN value for each node in the quadtree. Allows reuse of same list for performance reasons.

      • variance

        protected double variance(ESHyperNEATTranscriberBain.QuadPoint p,
              double[] tempStorageForCPPNValues)
        Determine the variance of a given region.
        Parameters:
        p - The root of the quadtree.
        tempStorageForCPPNValues - A list store the CPPN value for each node in the quadtree. Allows reuse of same list for performance reasons. This list will be cleared.
